content: (CBS) Acknowledging that the violent drug cartels of Mexico are now operating in many U.S. cities, America's Homeland Security secretary says every American has a stake in Mexico's war against the murderous gangs. Janet Napolitano appears in Anderson Cooper's report on the violence that last year claimed over 6,000 lives to be broadcast on 60 Minutes this Sunday, March 1, at 7 p.m. ET/PT. >http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2009/02/26/60minutes/main4831806.shtml
reply: (CBS) Acknowledging that the violent drug cartels of Mexico are now operating in many U.S. cities, America's Homeland Security secretary says every American has a stake in Mexico's war against the murderous gangs. content: This is a far greater priority than anything we can be doing in Iraq of Afghanistan. It affects us directly and is happening daily on our border and throughout Mexico, our close neighbor. Bring our troops home from Iraq now, and put them to work here. "I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies." - T. Jefferson
reply: This is a far greater priority than anything we can be doing in Iraq of Afghanistan. It affects us directly and is happening daily on our border and throughout Mexico, our close neighbor. Bring our troops home from Iraq now, and put them to work here. "I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies." - T. Jefferson
